title: This Week: How Far Does the Power of Brand Go?
summary: On Running and Tapestry report earnings this week amid rising inflation and cautious consumers. Following strong performances from Ralph Lauren and E.l.f. Beauty, these results will continue to test whether brand power is a match for economic uncertainty.

title: Brands Are Using OnlyFans Stars to Make Sex Sell, Again
summary: After years of risk aversion, brands are returning to more sex-centric advertising. The new twist on the age-old tactic incorporates everything from OnlyFans creators to steamy novels.

title: Olaplex Finds Success in Direct-to Consumer, Net Sales Increase
summary: The US hair care company reported a 2.3 percent sales gain, its first in four quarters, and has made inroads on its transformation strategy, chief executive Amanda Baldwin told The Business of Beauty.

title: End Times for Swiss Watchmakers?
summary: This week, President Trump’s tariff on Switzerland went into effect, landing levies of 39 percent on every watch the country exports to the US. For some Swiss watchmakers, the threat is existential.

title: Can a Shaving Company Teach Girl Scouts About Confidence?
summary: Flamingo, a brand under the Harry’s shaving umbrella, debuts a Merit Badge with the Girl Scouts of the USA for “body appreciation.”

title: London’s Luxury Hotels Have Hit Their Price Ceiling
summary: With more luxury openings driving up supply and economic uncertainty tamping down demand, top London hotels are recalibrating their prices.

title: Crocs Shares Slump 30% Amid Tariffs and Decline of ‘Ugly Shoe’ Trend
summary: Stock plummeted after the foam footwear maker predicted revenues could drop by between 9 and 11 percent in the current quarter, disappointing analysts who were expecting slight growth.

title: The BoF Podcast | James Whitner on Culture, Community and Building Brands with Purpose
summary: From the importance of playing the “long game” to staying optimistic amid social and political change, the founder of The Whitaker Group, known for boutiques like A Ma Maniére and Social Status, shares what it takes to merge culture, community, and commerce.

title: Under Armour Forecasts Downbeat Second-Quarter Sales
summary: The Maryland-based sportswear maker has struggled to drive up demand in the past two years, with efforts to revive the business having hit more roadblocks in recent months due to the Trump administration's shifting tariff policies.

title: Can India Become the World’s Fashion Factory?
summary: As US president Donald Trump’s punishing new tariffs come into force, India is working towards becoming an apparel manufacturing powerhouse despite long-standing obstacles.

title: Why Shoes Keep Shrinking: Flip-Flops, Flats and Slim Sneakers
summary: Thinner, more minimalist — naked, even — shoes are driving growth from sandals to sneakers.

title: Revolution Beauty Rejects Bid From Private Equity Firm, Sources Say
summary: The cosmetic group has rejected a takeover offer from True, a private equity firm, and is now likely to pursue a capital raise from existing shareholders.

title: Inside the First Dior Spa in the US
summary: The opening of the multi-level space atop Dior’s New York flagship is the latest move in the brand’s push into spas.

title: The RealReal Posts Record Quarterly Revenue, Raises Annual Forecast
summary: The luxury resale platform expanded its EBITDA margin as well, demonstrating that the secondhand fashion sector stands to benefit from tariffs and rising prices in high-end fashion.

title: How I Became… Reformation’s Chief Sustainability Officer
summary: Kathleen Talbot began her career researching food systems and teaching sustainability, before rising  to the C-suite at Reformation by prioritising mission over industry. Now, she shares her career advice.

title: ‘Liquid’ Butt Lifts as Part of Wider UK Cosmetic Procedures Clampdown
summary: Plans to cut down on 'cowboy' cosmetic procedures have been introduced by the government, meaning that only qualified healthcare professionals will be able to perform high-risk treatments.

title: Ralph Lauren Keeps Winning Streak Going, Raises Annual Outlook
summary: The American fashion company has been a standout among US apparel companies, managing to steadily increase prices in recent years — even before tariffs hit.

title: The Debrief | How Basketball Sneakers Got Their Groove Back
summary: A new era of bold designs and culturally influential athletes is reigniting interest in basketball sneakers, shifting the focus from nostalgia and celebrity collabs back to performance, personality and style.

title: A Letter to Kering’s New CEO
summary: Incoming chief executive Luca De Meo needs to urgently tackle two problems, debt levels and management structure, writes Luca Solca.

title: Warby Parker Announces Executive Changes, End of At-Home Try-On
summary: The eyewear maker said it will discontinue its longstanding program amid its ongoing brick-and-mortar expansion, and announced that its finance chief, Steve Miller, will leave the business in October.

title: Peloton Projects Sales Decline and Will Cut Jobs in Turnaround Bid
summary: The New York-based fitness technology company is laying off 6 percent of its workers globally.

title: E.l.f. Beauty Net Sales Rise 9%, Will Enter Sephora Middle East
summary: The cosmetics and skincare company saw sales rise for a 26th consecutive quarter, but declined to issue full-year guidance due to tariffs in the US.

title: Opinion: How Wellness Became Toxic
summary: If social media has amplified the “clean” beauty movement, it has also exposed it to poisonous misinformation, writes Lindsay Dahl.

title: Kenvue Forecasts Annual Profit Below Estimates Amid Strategic Review
summary: The global health company’s annual profit forecast fell below estimates, despite largely meeting quarterly earnings expectations.

title: African Beauty Brands Head to the Lab
summary: The African beauty market is dominated by natural and botanical brands, but a new crop of emerging indies are hoping to bring science-backed rigour to the continent and engage a new generation of shoppers.

title: Gen-Z and the Terrifying Rise of Extreme Tanning
summary: Despite warnings from medical professionals, many young people are embracing tanning trends, resorting to dangerous practices like sunbeds and unregulated nasal sprays.

title: Shiseido Sales Slide 7.6%, Profits Improve on Cost-Cutting Plan
summary: The Japanese beauty giant reported a sales decline in the first half of the year 2025 but a 21.3 percent increase in its operating profit as it implements a turnaround.

title: Shiseido’s Identity Crisis
summary: Japan’s largest beauty conglomerate has had a difficult time adjusting to the shifting cosmetics market, prompting a series of pivots and restructurings. Moving forward may require breaking with past mistakes.

title: Trump Doubles India Tariff to 50% to Punish Russian Oil Buying
summary: The US President’s move came hours after talks between Washington and Moscow over the war in Ukraine failed to yield an immediate breakthrough.

title: The Debrief | High Luxury, Cheap Labour: Inside Loro Piana’s Sweatshop Links
summary: The LVMH-owned cashmere brand is the fifth luxury label to be caught in an Italian scandal that has raised questions about the integrity of the sector’s vaunted supply chains. Sarah Kent joins The Debrief to unpack.

title: How The Estée Lauder Companies Engages Talent and Prioritises Values Amid Global Transformation
summary: The Estée Lauder Companies, which is behind global beauty brands including Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Clinique, Jo Malone London, La Mer and Tom Ford Beauty, has new leadership driving strategic change and innovation in the workplace. BoF speaks to Pernilla Nyberg, SVP and general manager of UK & Ireland, to learn how the company is engaging and supporting its employees amid the change.

title: The New DTC Rebranding Playbook
summary: Direct-to-consumer pioneers are refashioning themselves with new logos, slogans and revamped product lines to broaden their reach and build a legacy, without fully abandoning their original propositions.

title: How Afro Fashion Association Supports BIPOC Entrepreneurs in Sustainable Fashion
summary: Amid an industry grappling with setbacks in diversity and environmental responsibility, Milan’s Afro Fashion Association talent incubator is empowering a new generation of designers who merge creativity with sustainability. BoF sits down with five designers from the programme to learn more.

title: Tired of the Hamptons? Fashion Isn’t
summary: The lines are long, the prices astronomical and the influencer presence inescapable — but the Hamptons remain a key stage for brands chasing wealthy customers.

title: Oneskin Announces $20 Million Investment From Prelude Growth Partners
summary: The premium skincare brand will use the funds to further product development and support a slate of new hires.

title: Is Value Activewear’s Next Big Opportunity?
summary: The accessibly priced British DTC brand Adanola generated $112 million last year. Now, founder Hyrum Cook and new chief executive Niran Chana are making a major US push backed by private equity firm Story3.

title: Shopify Forecasts Quarterly Revenue Above Estimates on Resilient Demand
summary: Demand from retailers for its e-commerce services remains strong despite tariff-related anxiety.

title: Eyewear Is Booming, But It’s Not Just About Tech
summary: Once an afterthought, the category is now growing faster than handbags and apparel thanks to accessible pricing, distinct aesthetics and glasses brands that prioritise identity over gimmicks.

title: Opinion: Revenge of the Girlbosses
summary: A number of the “girlboss” founders are re-emerging in the business world, seemingly having shed their progressive political affiliations and focused on maintaining control of their ventures.

title: Amouage Sales Reach $200 Million in First Half of 2025
summary: The Omani luxury fragrance brand’s sales surged 60 percent year-over-year, with supersized growth in all of its international markets.

title: Hugo Boss Confident It Can Cushion US Tariff Blow
summary: The fashion group beat quarterly profit expectations on Tuesday despite warning of weak global demand.

title: JD.com to Launch Five Discount Stores as Competition Intensifies
summary: The Chinese retailer also announced that it would renew an international push for growth, launching its consumer-focused express delivery service abroad.

title: Online Retailer Zalando Raises 2025 Guidance After About You Acquisition
summary: The Berlin-based company said it expected gross merchandise volumes to grow by 12-15 percent, up from a previously expected range of 4-9 percent.

title: Shein and Temu Outpace Global Retail Giants in South Africa’s Fashion Market
summary: The China-founded e-tailers’ appeal to price-sensitive consumers has impacted local retailers.

title: Claire’s Files for US Bankruptcy for Second Time in Seven Years
summary: The tween jewellery retailer reported in court filings in Delaware that it had debts of between $1 billion and $10 billion.

title: Beiersdorf Shares Fall on Lowered Outlook, Moderate Growth
summary:
The European personal care giant saw its stock price slide 10
percent after lowering its full-year sales guidance.

title: Korean Beauty Startup Tops Industry Giant’s Market Value
summary: South Korean home-beauty device company APR Corp. surpassed an industry leader’s market value after its stock hit a record following strong second-quarter earnings, driven by surging overseas demand for its cosmetics and high-tech facial devices.

title: Bath & Body Works Targets College Bookstores to Woo Young Buyers
summary: The beauty retailer plans to sell products in approximately 600 US university bookstores, aiming to attract Gen-Z shoppers and boost sales.

title: The Estée Lauder Companies Joins BoF Careers
summary: Check out this week’s new partner and openings on BoF Careers, the global marketplace for fashion and beauty talent.

title: Announcing Uniqlo and Another Community on BoF Careers
summary: Check out this week’s new partners and openings on BoF Careers, the global marketplace for fashion and beauty talent.

title: Gucci Staff Threaten to Strike Over Welfare Payment Dispute
summary: Around 1,000 retail and logistics employees across Italy declared a ‘state of unrest’ after accusing the Kering-owned brand of withholding a promised welfare bonus.

title: Prada Promotes Christopher Bugg to Chief Communications Officer
summary: Bugg will oversee global communications for the group’s Prada, Miu Miu, Church’s and Car Shoe brands.

title: K-Makeup Couldn’t Go Global. Now It’s Trying Again.
summary: Ten years after they failed to catch on outside Asia, Korean cosmetic brands are bringing TikTok virality and expanded shade ranges back to the West in the hopes they can ride K-beauty’s second wave to success.

title: Saudi Arabia Bets on Nature in Latest Tourism Play
summary: The kingdom is investing billions in transforming a mountainous province the size of Austria into a luxury tourism destination.

title: Unpacking Fashion’s New AI Marketing Toolkit
summary: From Mango to Zalando, fashion brands are using AI tools to produce faster, cheaper and more personalised campaigns — but keeping content on-brand still requires human creativity and strategic control.

title: Swiss Watch Giant Navigates Trump’s Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Swatch Group CEO Nick Hayek has front-loaded shipments to the US, is targeting American shoppers as they travel abroad and has raised its prices as it grapples with a new 39 percent US tariff on Swiss-made products.

title: Can Hong Kong Reclaim Its Luxury Crown?
summary: Fashion and jewellery brands are playing the long game in Hong Kong, investing in high-profile events and store upgrades despite an exodus of big spenders to rival shopping hubs and the city’s diminishing status as a regional gateway.

title: Worldview | Colombia’s Record-Breaking Fashion Event
summary: This week’s round-up of global markets fashion business news also features ultra-fast-fashion brands in Mexico, China’s JD.com and the latest US tariffs on India, Bangladesh and Cambodia.

title: Is $4,000 a Night for a Hotel Room the New Normal?
summary: Prices have skyrocketed at luxury hotels, especially in top leisure markets. Will they ever come down?

title: Il Makiage Owner Oddity to Launch New Brand, Lifts Full-Year Outlook
summary: The US company’s net revenue grew 25% in the second quarter 2025 as it gears up to launch a new dermatological skin and body brand in the fall.

title: Fashion Mogul Hilary Weston Dies at 83
summary: The former lieutenant-governor of Ontario worked with department stores Selfridges Group, Holt Renfrew and Brown Thomas & Co.

title: BoF Masterclass | How Brands Build Genuine Communities
summary: Watch on demand a BoF Professional Masterclass that explores the topic in our latest case study, “How Brands Build Genuine Communities.”

title: Why Salone del Mobile Is Irresistible for Luxury Brands
summary: This week, designers, collectors and major fashion brands will flock to Milan’s design fair. Also, LVMH reports first-quarter sales.

title: Fashion and Design Collide at Salone Del Mobile
summary: Fashion’s presence at Milan Design Week grew even bigger this year. Savvy activations by brands including Hermès, Gucci, Bottega Veneta, Loewe and Prada showed how Salone has become a ‘critical petri dish for dalliances between design and fashion,’ Dan Thawley reports.

title: Fashion Goes Big at Salone, But Design Still Rules
summary: Fashion brands are edging in on the world’s largest gathering of design professionals and their wealthy clients, but design companies still dominate the sector, which is ripe for further consolidation, reports Imran Amed.

title: At Salone, Design Spectacle Takes Centre Stage
summary: The power of brand theatre was on display at Milan Design Week, reports Dan Thawley.

title: How to Sell Home Design Online
summary: E-tailers remain committed to homeware and design objects, despite the luxury sector’s post-pandemic cooldown. Here’s how fashion and design e-tailers stay ahead of the curve.

title: Why Are There So Many Luggage Brands?
summary: Tourists have their pick of suitcases at every price point, thanks to low barriers to entry and a travel boom that’s inflated the category’s sales year after year. But amid signs demand has peaked, it’ll take more than a Shopify storefront and slick branding to succeed.

title: How to Make a Members Club Work in New York
summary: Private clubs like LA’s San Vicente and London’s The Twenty Two are flooding New York City. Can they make membership a ‘must-have’ for a new generation of affluent New Yorkers?

title: Opinion: A Luxury Travel Bubble Is Swelling
summary: Hotels and airlines are chasing aspirational vacationers willing to shell out big bucks. What happens when they stop?

title: Chinese Tourists Ramp Up European Summer Trips as Americans Cut Back
summary: Increased Chinese demand will buoy hoteliers and restaurateurs across the continent as newly price-sensitive Americans hit the breaks on vacations in Europe.

title: Opinion: Members Clubs Just Aren’t What They Used to Be
summary: A new generation of private clubs has commodified elitism, argues Allison Schrager.

title: Hilton to Enter Cruise Business with Waldorf Astoria Nile Ship
summary: The hotel group’s Waldorf Astoria Nile River Experience, set to launch in late 2026, follows similar moves by Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons, Orient Express and Aman.

title: $50,000-a-Night Resort Signals Africa’s Future in Luxury Travel
summary: Capital from billionaire business moguls and Middle Eastern royals is pouring into Africa, filling a funding gap left by banks, as a new wave of ultra-luxury developments reshapes the continent’s hospitality landscape.

title: Can Design Be the Flex It Once Was in Beauty?
summary: In an increasingly competitive category, premium cosmetics labels like Merit and Sarah Creal Beauty are embracing more complex, distinctive — and costly — visual and sensorial touches to their products.

title: Fenty Beauty Launches in India With Sephora and Tira Beauty
summary: The LVMH-owned cosmetics label has signed an exclusive deal with Reliance Retail to launch Fenty Beauty and Fenty Skin online and in 50 doors.

title: Unilever India’s New CEO Has to Invigorate a Sluggish Consumer Giant
summary: Often seen as the bellwether of the consumer sentiment in the world’s most-populous nation, Hindustan Unilever was dragged down by a consumption slowdown in India over the past year.

title: Indie Beauty Brand Youthforia to Close
summary: The brand had been mired in controversy since 2024, when the botched roll out of its Date Night foundation led to accusations of racial insensitivity and exclusion.

title: For American Eagle, Is the Attention Worth the Controversy?
summary: A social media stir accusing the brand’s fall campaign featuring Sydney Sweeney of having “Nazi” undertones caused the retailer — for better or for worse — to regain social media mindshare.

title: Swiss Luxury Watchmakers’ Shares Drop After Trump Tariff Shock
summary: The sector is already under pressure from a stronger franc and falling global demand.

title: The Return of Estée Laundry
summary: Beauty’s anonymous Instagram watchdog is back after a hiatus, and already breaking news. In an interview with The Business of Beauty, a member of the collective explains why.

title: Why Hyping Art as an Investment Needs to Stop
summary: Positioning art as an ‘alternative asset class’ is a losing game, writes Marc Spiegler. Plus, ‘South Park’ trolls Trump and the art world’s new Thai fixation.

title: Italian Competition Authority Hits Shein with €1 Million Greenwashing Fine
summary: The Singapore-headquartered fast fashion retailer was fined for misleading customers about the environmental impact of its products in its second financial sanction by a European competition authority in little more than a month.

title: Italian Regulator Fines Giorgio Armani €3.5 Million for Unfair Commercial Practices
summary: The fashion group and one of its units ‘issued misleading ethical and social responsibility statements in contrast with the actual working conditions found at suppliers and subcontractors,’ Italy’s antitrust regulator said.

title: Introducing The Brain of Fashion
summary: The Business of Fashion’s new generative AI tool, trained exclusively on our deep archive of trusted journalism and intelligence, developed in partnership with Quilt AI. Today, we’re inviting our BoF Professional community to test it in beta mode.

title: The BoF Podcast | Why Craft Is the Soul of True Luxury
summary: In this riveting conversation from BoF CROSSROADS 2025, Mexican designer Carla Fernández and Tunisian entrepreneur Kenza Fourati discuss the power of craft-based fashion and how to collaborate ethically with artisans and indigenous communities.

title: This Week: The Aftermath of Liberation Day 2.0
summary: Trump’s tariffs are (probably) going into effect for real on Aug. 7. Meanwhile, Shiseido, E.l.f. and other beauty giants report results in a sluggish market.

title: Can Deodorant Be a Luxury Product?
summary: Deodorant makers like Salt and Stone or Papatui are infusing their formulas with high-quality scents to elevate their offering amid a greater perfume boom — and a looming sense of fine fragrance fatigue.

title: Report: Kering in Talks with Qatar to Offload Milan Property
summary: The French group may sell a majority stake in the company that owns the building to Qatar’s royal family for €1.3 billion, Italy’s Il Corriere della Sera newspaper said.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence Ulta
summary: DIBS Beauty says it’ll be “the top-selling Ulta brand” in 2026, and that its new double-sided mascara is key to unlocking the number one spot. Is that even possible?

title: Colgate-Palmolive Sales Rise, Announces Restructuring Plan
summary: The personal care giant beat expectations and delineated steps taken to mitigate the effects of tariffs, and will embark on a five-year cost-cutting plan.

title: Watches of Switzerland Tumbles After Trump’s 39 percent Tariff Salvo
summary: Shares in the retailer of Rolex and other Swiss timepieces fell as much as 6 percent, as Switzerland was hit with some of the highest duties globally.

title: China’s Fast-Fashion Capital Slows Down Under Trump’s Trade War
summary: Garment factories in Guangzhou are struggling to manage a tempest of geopolitical and economic headwinds.

title: Relief in Southeast Asia As Trump’s Tariffs Level Playing Field
summary: Major garment producers like Vietnam and Cambodia now face similar tariff rates of around 20 percent, lower than previously threatened.

title: End of US Parcel Tax Relief Threatens Ebay, Etsy Trade
summary: The removal of the “de minimis” exemption for small parcels entering the US will raise the cost of international shipments for the secondhand and craft retail platforms.

title: Asia Factory Outlook at Lowest Since Pandemic on Trump Tariffs
summary: Manufacturers in Southeast Asia are less optimistic about future growth, despite recent improvements in output, amid tariff uncertainty.

title: Hermès Valuation Woes Eclipse Sales Gain
summary: Shares fell as much as 4.7 percent even after the company reported second-quarter sales growth that far outpaced major luxury rivals.

title: Are Luxury Brands Responsible for What Happens in Their Supply Chains?
summary: An Italian union is seeking to hold Richemont legally accountable for alleged workers’ rights violations at a Montblanc supplier, as scandals linking brands like Dior, Armani, Valentino and Loro Piana to sweatshops draw more scrutiny to the sector’s sourcing practices.

title: Shein Revenue Neared $10 Billion in Quarter Before Tariffs
summary: Shein Group Ltd.’s net income rose to over $400 million and revenue was almost $10 billion in the first quarter.

title: Ferragamo Launches Action Plan After H1 Loss
summary: The Italian luxury group said it had put in place a plan to revive sales and relaunch its brand.

title: Space NK Opens Its Doors in Oxford Circus
summary: Customers waited through the night to be the first to shop at the newest Space NK store in central London.

title: John Lewis Pledges Multimillion-pound Investment in Beauty, Scores Fenty Beauty Partnership
summary: The British retailer will roll out six immersive, multisensory beauty halls nationwide this year, beginning with its Liverpool location.

title: Virality-driven Beauty Brands Are Reshaping the Industry, but Sustaining Momentum Remains Key Challenge
summary: A new report highlights the TikTok-fueled growth of brands like Medicube, Anua and Sacheu Beauty, while emphasizing the importance of innovation and retention for long-term success.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Gwyneth Paltrow’s Goop Doubles Down on Beauty, Expands Into Ulta Stores Nationwide
summary: The wellness brand is entering 800 Ulta Beauty locations on Sunday.

title: Soko Glam to Launch K-beauty Shops-in-shop at Space NK
summary: The shops-in-shop will roll out to 30 Space NK doors beginning Aug. 12.

title: PR Agency Studio Beauty Acquires Wellness Firm Powers PR, Expands With Wellness Division
summary: Powers PR founder Lana Powers joins as chief growth officer across categories.

title: E.l.f. Beauty Expands Global Footprint With Sephora
summary: The beauty brand strengthens its retail presence with Sephora in the Middle East, Dollar General in the U.S. and rising international sales, while navigating tariffs.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Lili Reinhart’s Skin Care Brand Personal Day Set to Enter Ulta Beauty, Marking Its Inaugural Move Into Retail
summary: The TikTok-viral brand was co-founded by the "Riverdale" actress and CEO Shelagh Wong in October 2024.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Actress Deepika Padukone’s Beauty Brand 82°E Launches Distribution Partnership with the PCA Companies
summary: 82°E, pronounced 82 East, was initially founded in 2022 as a Mumbai-based, direct-to-consumer skin care brand offering science-based products with ingredients indigenous to India.

title: Mecca Unveils the World’s Biggest Freestanding Beauty Store
summary: Call it Mecca to the Max. On Friday, the Melbourne-based retailer will open the doors to a 40,000-square-foot flagship in its hometown, designed to give shoppers the ultimate beauty experience.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: This summer, beauty boards the Hampton Jitney
summary: Every day of every weekend during the summer, the famed Hampton Jitney sends anywhere between 50-100 buses to the Hamptons. And if you're an extra lucky passenger, in addition to getting a summer weekend in one of the East Coast's most desirable seasonal destinations, you may find a full-size Goop moisturizer or an L.L. Bean Boat and Tote waiting on your seat when you board the bus.

title: Glossy Podcast: Zara’s banned ads, Gucci’s labor dispute, Capri’s recovery — and a chat with Anthropologie’s Anu Narayanan
summary: We speak with Anu Narayanan, the president of women’s and home at Anthropologie, about the company’s decision to spin off one of its private labels, Maeve, into its own standalone brand. Narayanan also gave insight on her leadership style, the right time to invest in business expansion and the importance of bringing in new perspectives.

title: Ralph Lauren’s handbag bet gains ground as Q1 sales beat expectations
summary: Ralph Lauren beat Q1 expectations with a strong push into handbags. Its handbag sales are outpacing growth in core categories, as the company aims to fill white space in the leather goods market.

title: E.l.f Beauty CEO talks price increases and Sephora expansion: ‘We see the potential to more than double our business’
summary: El.f. Beauty is deepening its relationship with Sephora with several international rollouts.

title: Bath & Body Works products will now be sold at college bookstores
summary: The Ohio-based personal care company will begin rolling out kiosks and displays at more than 600 campus bookstores across the U.S. throughout the month of August. Outside of duty-free retail, the college bookstore expansion marks the first time Bath & Body Works products will be sold outside of its own stores as it seeks to court its core demographic of teen consumers.

title: Fashion Briefing: True Religion’s exuberant marketing strategy is already paying off
summary: The denim brand True Religion is well on its way to the goal of $1 billion in annual sales. And according to CMO Kristen D’Arcy, an ambitious marketing strategy at a time when many other brands are pulling back on ad spend has been key to its growth.

title: An insider’s guide to K-beauty’s US renaissance, plus industry news
summary: On this week's episode of the Glossy Beauty Podcast, co-host Lexy Lebsack interviews Sara Spruch-Feiner about her recent reporting on the return of K-beauty, diving into what's fueling K-beauty's renewed popularity, what trending ingredients are capturing attention and how affordability continues to play a key role in the category’s appeal.

title: Sex is in for summer: How Neutrogena got in on #SteamyBookTok with its latest launch
summary: To launch its new Vitamin C serum, Neutrogena did something unexpected for the 94-year-old brand: It tapped 31-year-old Serena Kerrigan, social media's self-proclaimed "Queen of Confidence," to pen two steamy stories for a mini book called "Bank Your Glow." They're now available on Wattpad, the free online platform for sharing stories.

title: Luxury Briefing: Chanel data breach signals rising luxury cyber risks
summary: In this week's luxury briefing, a look at the growth of credential stuffing to hack luxury houses for customer data, as well as Hugo Boss's earnings and news to know.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: How brands are shifting budgets to offset tariffs, plus industry news
summary: This week, I checked in with beauty and wellness brand leaders to learn how they’re offsetting the cost of tariffs without increasing prices. Additionally, executive shakeups at Sephora, Novo Nordisk and Saltair; plus, P&G, Kering Beauté, L’Oréal Group, and Unilever report earnings.

title: Glossy+ Research: From content scaling to live-selling pivots, how emerging brands are evolving their marketing playbooks
summary: Emerging brands are reshaping their marketing with customer-created content, affiliate-driven storytelling and in-house live selling, while navigating platform challenges and attribution complexity.

title: Anthropologie launches sub-brand Maeve as a new standalone brand
summary: Today, Anthropologie is relaunching its Maeve private label as a standalone brand. The launch will come with all the bells and whistles of a standalone brand, including dedicated Maeve physical stores, dedicated Maeve social media channels, an influencer launch event and a full marketing campaign.

title: ‘I’m just trying to keep in the game’: Beauty founders react to August’s new tariff rates
summary: President Trump’s evolving tariff policy has rocked many business owners since he took office in January. On August 7, new tariff rates will go into effect for a number of trade partners. But the uncertainty caused by changing tariff policies throughout the second Trump administration has already had a domino effect on brands.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Beauty’s new favorite way to launch a product? With a blank Instagram grid
summary: In 2013, Kanye West and Lady Gaga deleted their respective Twitter feeds to clear the metaphorical air for their new artistic eras — West for his new album, "Yeezus," and Lady Gaga for hers, "ARTPOP." Flash forward 12 years, and the clearing of the grid is a widely used tactic in beauty marketing, too.

title: Glossy Podcast: American Eagle’s controversy, Vogue’s AI ad, Quince’s mega-valuation — and Ty Haney’s return
summary: This week on the Glossy podcast, we break down American Eagle’s Sydney Sweeney controversy, Vogue’s first AI Guess ad and Quince’s $4.5 billion raise, plus senior reporter Sara Spruch Feiner weighs in on Ty Haney’s Outdoor Voices comeback.

title: As AI changes discovery, Nyx Professional Makeup doubles down on Roblox for brand awareness
summary: Nyx Professional Makeup takes over Roblox’s Bayside High for back-to-school, tapping into Gen Z’s virtual worlds as AI reshapes beauty discovery.

title: K-beauty darling Krave Beauty’s Liah Yoo on building an ethical supply chain amid tariff pressure, plus industry news
summary: Krave Beauty isn’t your average K-Beauty brand. Unlike the 12-step skin-care routines Korea is known for, Krave is based on streamlining one’s routine with minimal products that strengthen the skin’s barrier. CEO and co-founder Liah Yoo joins the Glossy Beauty Podcast to discuss her journey building an ethical supply chain — where everyone is treated and paid fairly — for its hero serum, Great Barrier Relief.

title: Fashion Briefing: As dupe lawsuits profilerate, brands weigh when it’s worth taking dupers to court
summary: Legal experts told Glossy that dupe lawsuits are becoming increasingly common in the fashion industry and reflect a growing concern among brands that dupes are a real threat to their livelihood.

title: Led by pro hair-care sales, L’Oréal Group reported 1.6% sales growth during the first half of the year
summary: Professional product sales won the first half for L’Oréal Group with a 4.9% sales jump. Highlights include new franchises from Kérastase — including Genesis and Gloss Absolu — as well as Metal Detox by L’Oréal Professionnel, Acidic Bonding Concentrate by Redken and Food for Soft by Matrix.

title: Exclusive: Dezi Skin is the latest influencer-founded brand to hit Sephora
summary: In the influencer world, Desi Perkins is an OG — Perkins got her start on YouTube via an accidentally viral makeup video. In 2020, she launched Dezi, an approachably priced collection of sunglasses. A year later, she introduced Dezi Skin, with just one product, a vitamin C serum called Claro Que C. Five years later, Perkins is launching the brand at Sephora — online-only, to start.
